title: Electronic Engineer Job at Salpha Energy Limited
content:
Salpha Energy Limited - We are passionate about off-grid energy. Salpha Energy is a for profit social business and manufactures honest, reliable solar products designed to help people living off the electric grid.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electronic Engineer
Job Location: Ojo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a versatile and visionary Electronics Engineer to lead the end-to-end design, integration, and validation of complex electronic systems and enclosures—specifically for solar-powered inverter and energy products. 
	As Salpha expands its in-house manufacturing capabilities, this role is critical in ensuring product designs move from concept to production efficiently, cost-effectively, and at scale.
	The ideal candidate has deep experience in PCB design, electronic system architecture, and cross-functional product integration, and is ready to take ownership of critical development initiatives. 
	You’ll also lead the integration of plastic housings with electronic components, ensuring that every product is optimized for performance, safety, manufacturability, and scalability.
	You’ll collaborate closely with our technical team to bring Salpha’s next-generation solar solutions to life delivering products that meet the highest standards of durability and quality.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and develop high-performance electronic systems for inverter and solar products, from concept to production.
	Create PCB layouts using tools such as Altium Designer, Eagle PCB, and Cadence Allegro
	Select components, analyze signal integrity, and ensure compliance with reliability standards.
	Lead schematic design, system integration, and prototyping.
	Collaborate with mechanical, QA, and procurement teams to deliver on time and within budget.
	Apply SMT and THT techniques across single-layer to multi-layer PCBarchitectures.
	Ensure manufacturing readiness using Design for Manufacturability (DFM) and Design for Assembly (DFA) principles.
	Conduct system testing and validation to ensure product quality and reliability.
	Document designs and lead technical reviews with stakeholders.


Qualifications


	Degree in Electrical / Electronics Engineering, or equivalent.
	3-5+ years in electronics hardware design, especially in inverter, energy, or power electronics.
	Advanced knowledge of PCB design tools and best practices.
	Proven experience with system-level integration and manufacturing-scale handover.
	Exposure to field reliability testing (heat, drop, ingress protection).
	Prior work with solar kits, IoT devices, or battery-powered products.


Qualities We’re Looking For:


	Excellent communication and documentation skills.
	Strong leadership and cross-functional collaboration abilities.
	Detail-oriented and committed to quality and innovation.
	Blends electronic precision with mechanical awareness.
	Practical, hands-on thinker who can lead from design to test.
	Fast learner and highly collaborative, especially with non-technical teammates.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: salpha@salphaenergy.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Data Analyst Job at Salpha Energy Limited
content:
Salpha Energy Limited is a renewable energy company determined to provide affordable solar solutions for everyone. We are addressing the huge market need for energy by enabling people harness the infinite source of light that freely accessible to everyone. Innovations in renewable technology afford us the opportunity to place power back in the hands of people, through innovative and quality conscious products that are built to last for outdoor campaing, entrepreneurial activities, rural settlements or disaster relief.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Analyst

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We’re looking for a results-driven Data Analyst, who will be instrumental in powering smarter decisions across Salpha Energy’s operations. 
	Your mission: ensure accurate data reconciliation, drive operational intelligence, and fuel business growth with insights that matter.
	You will own data pipelines, automate reporting processes, and provide deep visibility into everything.


Key Responsibilities


	Automate reports and build dashboards to track financials, operations, and product performance.
	Monitor KPIs across key operations; surface insights to improve efficiency.
	Support product and business teams with dashboards, cohort analyses, and insight briefs.
	Deploy and manage BI platforms like Looker, Holistics, or Quicksight to streamline reporting.
	Take charge and be a decision driver for assigned web platforms.
	Drive smarter decision-making by tying data to ROI, customer outcomes, and product quality.
	Reconcile payments across platforms and internal systems; flag and fix data mismatches.
	Use Python and low-code tools to automate repetitive data tasks.
	Keep up-to-date on emerging technology solutions, particularly those on JavaScript, for continuous improvements in front-end application development and end-user experience.
	Clearly explain issues, decisions, and technical solutions to cross-functional teams.


Requirements
Qualities We’re Looking For:


	Excellent communication and documentation skills.
	Strong leadership and cross-functional collaboration abilities.
	Detail-oriented and committed to quality and innovation.
	Blends electronic precision with mechanical awareness.
	Practical, hands-on thinker who can lead from design to test.
	Fast learner and highly collaborative, especially with non-technical teammates.


Qualifications


	Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management,Statistics.
	Advanced SQL proficiency (cohort analysis, complex joins, window functions, etc.).
	Experience with Python for exploratory data analysis and automation
	Knowledge of reporting tools like Looker/Holistics/Quicksight.
	Experience: Proven experience in data analysis, working with business users to create reports and dashboards, and delivering actionable insights. Familiarity with statistical packages (e.g., Google Sheets, Python libraries).
	Skills: Strong problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, critical thinking, and business acumen.
	Ability to communicate insights clearly & collaborate with cross-functional teams.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Application and CV to: salpha@salphaenergy.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Network Service Delivery Job at Equinix
content:
Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, operating over 260 data centers across the globe. Digital leaders harness Equinix's trusted platform to bring together and interconnect foundational infrastructure at software speed. Equinix enables organizations to access all the right places, partners and possibilities to scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences and multiply their value, while supporting their sustainability goals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Network Service Delivery

Job ID: JR-151389
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time, Hybrid
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	The Network Service Delivery Engineer will be responsible for the first- and second-line network monitoring, change management, incident management and escalations, management of managed service vendors, and providing support on the network serving nodes using various network management tools and trouble-ticketing systems.
	This includes diagnosing and locating faults, performing repairs, maintenance, and reporting to ensure optimal customer satisfaction.


Responsibilities


	To provide daily support (8 am -5 pm), 5 working days/week as a Network service delivery engineer, if needed, you may be required to work beyond stipulated working hours and over weekends
	Ensure proactive monitoring of Primetime customer services on MainOne’s network using the available NMS (Network Monitoring System), providing specific updates, status, and performance of all the services
	Ensure there is a ticket / open a trouble ticket (TT) for every Primetime-related fault and that it is tracked, updated, and managed throughout the incident's life cycle up to the point of closure within OLAs
	Ensure that any equipment faults affecting Primetime Customers are rectified promptly and efficiently
	Responsible for providing remote support and troubleshooting for all identified faults on the network, interfacing with the assigned MainOne Vendor and third party, and escalating to Level 3 (TX Implementation and IP Operations) where it cannot be resolved at Level 2
	Maintain and ensure full compliance with all MainOne’s NOC Operations processes and procedures
	Monitor Primetime customers' performance on MainOne's global network, flag anomalies, and collaborate with stakeholders to resolve any challenges to customer satisfaction
	Ensure accurate Ticket logging, timely updates, and communication by Primetime Service NOC to other engineers during the life cycle of an IPLC, IP, or VOIP-related incident
	Ensure that all escalated IP, IPLC, or VOIP tickets are resolved within agreed-upon timelines and handled professionally
	Manage appropriate communication to achieve an excellent service experience during the incident handling
	Answer all Primetime customer support-related telephone calls and interface with internal and external stakeholders on operational issues and related network events, using Main One’s standard operating procedures to address all issues
	Ensure that circuit handover or acceptance of new services is carried out in accordance with MainOne’s standards, capturing all necessary information and saving it in DMS, in compliance with our corporate policy
	Handle escalated trouble ticket calls, working closely with other NOC engineers, and last-mile providers, and managed service vendors to resolve issues promptly
	Ensure that change management processes for Primetime customers are adhered to ensure customer satisfaction
	Ensure network KPIs are met (Network Availability 99.99%, and MTTR 4 hours NHW, 6 hours HW)
	Provide technical support to managed service vendors 24/7 to meet and exceed customers’ expectations
	Ensure quarterly training is conducted for the vendor support engineers, covering technical aspects and operational expectations
	Undertake any other ad hoc assignment that may be assigned by the Ghana Transmission and CLS Manager


Qualifications


	A Bachelor’s Degree in Telecom Engineering, Computer Science, or Equivalent in Information and Communications Technology


Relevant Professional / Technical Certifications:


	1-2 years of work experience in configuration, operations, and maintenance of fiber optical nodes, Carrier Ethernet nodes, MW radio (PTP, PTMP), IP network troubleshooting skills, (Cisco-Ciena, FortiGate routers & switches), fiber optics cable handling and OTDR traces, and basic knowledge in power rectification systems
	Network certification, such as Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) or equivalent, is desired. Strong understanding of GPON, FTTx architectures, and related technologies


Competencies Required:


	Must have fair knowledge of optical networks such as DWDM/OTN/SDH/SONET/GPON, FTTx, and working knowledge of Ciena OME 6500 series, Ciena switches, Cisco routers and switches
	Ability to read, review, interpret and understand technical documents (e.g., schematics, drawings, blueprints, layouts) and implement them into the network in an efficient manner if required
	Microwave radio advanced configuration skills and troubleshooting
	Basic knowledge in configuring and troubleshooting L1 and L2 issues for Cisco and Ciena equipment
	Fair understanding of OSPF, TCP/IP, Enterprise Wireless, and L2 technologies
	TCP/IP, Network Security, VoIP and OSPF networking experience required
	Extensive knowledge of Spanning Tree, VLAN’s, VTP, and Trucking protocols
	Good knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and MS SharePoint
	Able to work well within a busy team and handle a wide range of issues. Capable of multi-tasking, good time management and prioritization of workload
	Ability to drive managed vendors to prioritize and resolve problems and identify future needs
	Able to use initiative to tackle a broad range of problems, while still following procedures and processes
	Ability to maintain composure and customer-service focus in stressful and ambiguous situations
	Familiar with the use of various test equipment, i.e. OSA, OTDR, Ethernet Analyser, Transmission Analysers, Optical power meters, etc.

title: Cashier / Inventory Officer Job at Salpha Energy Limited
content:
Salpha Energy is a renewable energy company determined to provide affordable solar solutions for everyone. We are addressing the huge market need for energy by enabling people harness the infinite source of light that freely accessible to everyone. Innovations in renewable technology afford us the opportunity to place power back in the hands of people, through innovative and quality conscious products that are built to last for outdoor campaing, entrepreneurial activities, rural settlements or disaster relief.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier / Inventory Officer
Job Location: Yenagoa, Bayelsa 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As the Cashier / Inventory Officer, you will work closely with the location’s sales officers to facilitate customer purchasing, as well as handling and ensuring payments by the customer.
	You are saddled with the responsibility of handling stocks and inventory in the location of your operation by ensuring proper handling, receiving and documentation of the inventory received.
	You will be responsible for processing and receiving payments, issuing receipt and ensure proper documentation in the drive.


Key Responsibilities
Sales Transactions:


	Assist to achieve branch budgeted sales and profit target.
	Collecting payments for products either in cash or credit.
	Accepting payments, ensuring all prices and quantities are accurate and providing receipt for every sales transaction.
	Ensure products presented by customers are properly handled to the satisfaction of the customer.
	Cross checking items presented for purchase by customers to see that they are in good condition.
	Track sales transactions and report any discrepancies to the management.
	Resolving customers’ complaints. Inventory Management:
	Ensure regular stock count at least twice in a month.
	Receive and handling of the location’s inventories/Stock.
	Ensure accountability and safety of the location’s inventory.
	Ensure stock release only on approval of the Sales Order Form.
	Have proper knowledge of all companies’ products and prices.
	Escalate issues relating to inconsistencies in inventory to the financial accountant.


Cash Management:


	Make deposit of cash received to the bank.
	Daily reconciliations of cash and bank.
	Regular checks/phone calls to customers indebted to the company.


Record Keeping:


	Balancing the cash register and generating reports for credit and debit sales.
	Maintain accurate record of inventory sent to the station.
	Documenting sales, payments, and credits sales on the drive.
	Ensuring proper documentation of stocks and inventory issued out for sales.
	Keep proper record of cash and expenses within the location. Station Management:
	Maintain clean and tidy warehouse/storeroom and other equipment.
	Perform any other duties that may be assigned.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting / Business Administration / Economics or any relevant field with 3 - 5 years of experience
	Computer Savvy
	Excellent knowledge of Google Suites
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills
	Relationship management skills and openness to feedback
	Proven experience as a cashier is an added advantage.
	Candidates must reside in the job location.


Key Qualities Expected:
Appearance and Dressing:


	The Cashier/Inventory Officer will be clean and neatly attired while on duty in a manner befitting of your position.
	Teamwork – Ability to work within a diverse team with the aim of actualizing organizational goal above personal gains.
	An eye for details.
	Good knowledge of Inventory Management.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines.
	Result and service orientation.
	Ability to multi-task effectively.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@salphaenergy.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.
